messages.content: What is ComfyUI-AniPortrait and how is it updated?
ComfyUI-AniPortrait is a GUI that uses the AniPortrait model to generate animated portraits. It is updated with support for the new version of diffusers due to the contribution from WainWong.
What is the minimum recommended Python version and CUDA version for building the environment?
The minimum recommended Python version is >=3.10 and the CUDA version is =11.7.
How can I install the required packages for ComfyUI-AniPortrait?
To install the required packages, run the command `pip install -r requirements.txt`.
What are the trained weights included with AniPortrait?
The trained weights included with AniPortrait are `denoising_unet.pth`, `reference_unet.pth`, `pose_guider.pth`, `motion_module.pth`, and `audio2mesh.pt`.
What are the pretrained weights and components required for AniPortrait?

The pretrained weights and components required for AniPortrait are [StableDiffusion V1.5](https://huggingface.co/runwayml/stable-diffusion-v1-5), [sd-vae-ft-mse](https://huggingface.co/stabilityai/sd-vae-ft-mse), [image_encoder](https://huggingface.co/lambdalabs/sd-image-variations-diffusers/tree/main/image_encoder), and [wav2vec2-base-960h](https://huggingface.co/facebook/wav2vec2-base-960h).
Where can I find the AniPortrait repository?
The AniPortrait repository can be found at [AniPortrait](https://github.com/Zejun-Yang/AniPortrait).
